Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Toine M
Reviews.Content: Visted this hotel for business. The rooms are comfortable and staff is friendly. The hotel offers a variety of restaurants and bars. It is close to the airport but not close to the center of Istanbul. I can recommend this hotel if you do not have to be in the center. If had a room with a view on the Marmara sea that is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “really comfortable business stay”
Reviews.Author: tirzan65
Reviews.Content: I had been staying for 2 nights on a business conference paid by company in this big hotel by the seaside. Service was quite good, personnel really helpful and always smiling. Appreciated a break in a gym with real good equipment, would have loved to try the pool but this was for seagull only in that chilly spring time :-(. Too many restaurants and bars, cannot test them all (there is also a Bavarian beer garden). A resonating noice disturbed a bit my 1st night in a room at 5th floor - likely coming from A/C unit making the glass window resonate. The noise disappeared the 2nd night. Nice walking area in the nearby to get a walk and fresh air by the seaside.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMarieR
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay one night near Istanbul's Ataturk Airport in preparation for an early morning flight the following day. We chose the Renaissance Polat. It's quite nice and part of the Marriott chain. It's a large property with all of the usual amenities and some particular to the region. There were multiple restaurants, an upscale bar, a patisserie, jewelry store and more. It has an outdoor pool and is located on the Bosphorus, so it's the perfect place to spend time outside when the weather is nice. Their breakfast buffet is extensive and delicious and free--or at least it was with the rooms we booked. The rooms themselves are what you'd expect from a business style hotel. The decor in the bathroom is a little dated (and the tub is crazy narrow). But really, it's a well-maintained hotel with courteous staff. Only about ten minutes from the airport with free shuttle service, it more than fit our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Business convenient !”
Reviews.Author: azafiris
Reviews.Content: Near the airport and exchibition, is the ideal hotel to stay for a couple of days for busines. Clean and safe with a spectacular view of the sea. I vote for.

Reviews.Title: “Good food, excellent staff and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Jr444
Reviews.Content: This hotel has much to recommend it. Its not sparkly new but it has a lovely old feel and the staff are great. I thought the food was particularly good, the views are great and its very convenient for the airport. Loved the little coffee shop/patisserie in the lobby. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The reliable Polat”
Reviews.Author: Dublin TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a million times but never reviewed it. There is nothing too wow about the Polat and frankly, the rooms are beginning to feel a bit 90s. But I keep coming back. Why? Convenience factor and gym. If you have business near the airport, it's ideal - traffic in Istanbul is a nightmare. Plus there are good restaurants nearby for business dinners and, in my case, many of my clients' offices are in the Florya district. And then there's that gym, indoor and outdoor pool. Used by hotel goers and outsiders, it is a full gym and great for a work-out. And I have to say, having gone there for over 10 years (or more!), it has some lovely staff with what seems to be a pretty low turnover. These guys care about giving a good service. Overall, they should probably bite the bullet and start a full refurbishment... still best option around Ataturk airport

Reviews.Title: “FDesk staff needs training. Rooms need to be overhauled.”
Reviews.Author: serokisa
Reviews.Content: Although I called the hotel (guess how many people do this nowadays..) and had my simple request "top floor - large bed - sea view" confirmed in the response email, it took me a major effort to get a room which was somewhat close to the confirmed one. First, the receptionist intended to send me to the cellar. Then, after I showed the confirmation email, I was given a high room with TWO SEPARATE BEDS and NOT SEA VIEW. Then I requested the Duty Manager... and was given a room with sea view and large bed, but rather middle floor. Of course, I heard a lot of explanations "we are full bla bla" - but I called well in advance and had my detailed confirmation BECAUSE I ENVISAGED FULL OCCUPANCY. Rooms look old (carpet, etc) Staff enters rooms without permission. And I don't want strangers see me in bed!

Reviews.Title: “Black Mold on bathroom”
Reviews.Author: allinthesky
Reviews.Content: Excellent bed and service. Only complain....found black mold formation in the shower. All it takes is some clorox to remove it. Room was number 805 and if someone goes there will find that black fungus formation due to humidity in the shower sink. That detail was only complain for a Hotel that gives you a great service overall. But with little clorox and more Quality Inspection on the shower, they shall fix it correctly.(I hope they fix that).

Reviews.Title: “VERY HELPFUL STAFF :)”
Reviews.Author: Haitham_dublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night " not planned" but it was a fantastic experience to everyone in my family " especially the kids" now everyone wants to go there in the next trip to Istanbul :)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: Salar O
Reviews.Content: A wonderfull hotel, but lil expensive, you shouldn't need to go to the city a lot

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - near major airport, about 1 hour to city centre”
Reviews.Author: BAC6815
Reviews.Content: Usually, when coming to Istanbul, I arrive at AtatÃ¼rk International airport - this hotel does provide a free shutlle bus and is also close enough for any business meetings you may have planned. It does offer all ammenities you expect from 5 -star hotels, indoor- outdoor pool, massages, hairdresser, jewelery shops etc. .You can take a taxi to the center (Eurpean side) and it will cost you about 25 Euros - or take the local bus for 1 Euro (taskersd little bit longer). If you are a smoker, the hotel is a non-smoking hotel - but if you ask for the Garden Rooms - you may get a smokers room. If you are caught somking in other rooms you really are fined up to 180 Euros. Staff is verxy competent and friendly, good areas for meetings (Lobby area)

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 5 nights”
Reviews.Author: 150Londonjp
Reviews.Content: Staff helpful good position by the sea but hotel Ä±s getÄ±ng old. Rooms ok but bathrooms dated and need refurbished

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Istanbul getaway”
Reviews.Author: GraceDyese
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not located in the city centre but close by the airport. You can easily reach the city centre either by taxi or by taking the complementary shuttle of the hotel. (simply ask the schedule at the reception desk). The staff is really helpful and friendly. One housekeeper had accidentally broken a make up case and I received an apology letter and compensation. Indoor and outdoos swimming pool is definitely a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for value-seekers with great service”
Reviews.Author: Libby5580
Reviews.Content: If you want a full service hotel with reasonably good security, gym, spa, pool, great views, restaurants and room service and don't mind being outside the city center, this one is for you. To spend a few days touring Istanbul on my own I'd be more likely to choose the Four Seasons or another spot in the Sultanhamet, but I wanted to spare my 70-ish parents the stickershock, and we also had rented a car, so we weren't put off by the 20 minute drive, which is easy and direct along the water to tourist center. The hotel is also very close to the airport, so good for in and out business travelers, but it is not an airport hotel. While still pricey and having a dated 70-80s feel to it (it could use some updating), as well as VERY slow elevators, it has many pluses. It offers a wide range of room types (due to odd circumstances we stayed in four different rooms including a suite), offers stunning views of the glimmering straits with ships lined up waiting to pass through, has lovely gardens and a huge swimming pool, offers a full service gym and spa and all the standard amenities you could want. It is very international, which to me is a plus - Russians, Saudis, and Europeans as well as Turks and Americans. The hotel is American owned but doesn't advertise its ownership and is a favorite for weddings. There is a lovely pastry shop in the lobby and the food in the restaurant is good, not great. The service is very polite, professional and caring altho the staff can get stress at checkout time; when we thought my mother mislaid her purse in the hotel, they scoured the place to try to find it; additionally, when my parents arrived early and we had requested an early checkin, they accommodated and actually moved us to a larger room. The exterior garden rooms are very small, but the ground floor attached "garden wing doubles" are extremely spacious-they are the steal of this hotel. There is security at all entrances, including the underground garage and the hotel is self-contained and well removed from other buildings. Room service breakfasts are generous and cost the same as a breakfast in the dining room. The gym and pool appear to be available to locals as well as hotel guests so they can become quite crowded at peak hours. The seafood restaurant next to the hotel (not the one actually connected to the hotel) is expensive but excellent. For those staying a bit longer, the hotel is located in a residential neighborhood and a local grocery store (which sells wine and beer) is tucked across the street facing the park square.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: chickeeta210
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located by the airport. If you prefer to venture out on your own by foot - this isn't the best location. It is a good 20 minutes away from the city. The hotel however has hourly shuttles to and from the main city. It also provides free shuttle from the airport to the hotel. So even though it's not centrally located in the city, it's more cost effective than staying at a hotel within the city. The staff is very helpful though language is bit of an issue. The hotel is kept very clean. We ate once in the seafood restaurant and it was surprisingly a good price (from a New Yorker's point of view). Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay near Ataturk Airport.”
Reviews.Author: painter012
Reviews.Content: This is a great, modern luxury hotel very close to the airport for early morning or afternoon flights out of Ataturk.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay as always”
Reviews.Author: AussieNarelle
Reviews.Content: I have just had a very busy month of traveling and it was nice to come "home" to this hotel. It is close to the airport and great for early morning departures. There is an airport shuttle, but a taxi ride is less than 10TL if the timing for the shuttle does not work for you. I stayed in a deluxe garden room and these are huge! Never stayed in one of these rooms before and as well as a dining table, there is a desk, and a lounge/settee as well as additional chairs. And the bathroom had a tub as well as a shower (the other garden rooms only have a shower - not a huge deal for me as I generally do not have a bath). And of course there is shampoo and conditioner, and large bench area in the bathroom. The only issue I have is that although it was a non-smoking room, it can be used by smokers, so has that stale cigarette smell which I hate, but it was only one night. The spa, including a hamam, sauna and steam rooms as well as the indoor pool where you can swim lengths as well as a great gym, is a wonderful feature at this hotel. I did not have a massage this trip, but they have always been good when I have had one. Breakfast is always a nice selection (Turkish and western and Japanese) at Daphne's and great views of the sea. However, the highlight for me was the check-out. After the horrific experience at the hotel the day before it was so nice for all to go smoothly. A friend had joined me for breakfast and I had not been charged for the breakfasts. I queried whether I should be charged, they called down to the restaurant and said since they had not put through the charge at the time of my check-out (which was an hour later), they would provide the breakfast on a complimentary basis since I was so honest! Contrast that with the Siwssotel and they got a mark of 5/5 for making it that easy for me. Will be back again, next time I am back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Arrived in the early hours no shuttle available”
Reviews.Author: russellh731
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Istanbul airport around 1 am to find no shuttle had to get a taxi , wich caused me stress as the taxi driver was not happy in taking me on such a short trip. tried to book the shuttle the next day to the airport to find 2 hours during the day (around lunch) the shuttle was not available again , had to get another taxi i booked this hotel for the shuttle. The hotel is overpriced The rooms are comfortable and quiet

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: AliceLiddell7
Reviews.Content: Positive; The helpful, respectful and friendly staff, large rooms and beds, 5 stars sleep quality, room service is very fast, room service menu and the taste is excellent, breakfast buffet is very varied. The Hotel in a quiet environment and the landscape is very beautiful, Negative; No fresh orange juice served at the breakfast Buffet :)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience!”
Reviews.Author: amn82
Reviews.Content: I'm not hard to please, but this hotel is just bad. - The parking lot entrance is very narrow and dangerous. I consider my self a skilled and experienced driver but still I consider my self lucky I didn't scratch my rental car. You need to be very slow and cautious. If you have a long or a wide car, you might get stuck in the narrow curve. I can't believe it's not free of charge! - I asked for a US-standard power adapter to charge my computer. They asked me to pay about $30 as insurance and sign a document. They returned the amount when I checked out but I think the hassle of paperwork was not worth it. I don't think the value of the power adapter is more than $2. - Although it's expensive ($14/day), the wireless internet connection is extremely slow. It was impossible for me to make Skype phone calls. - The hotel's "policy" prevents customers from bringing food back to their rooms. - The reception employees are rude and most of the hotel staff doesn't speak English, at all! - The bathroom was not clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: langoli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 210 min to the international airport. They have an airport shuttle, but it starts at 6:30. My flight departed at 8:10 in the morning, therefore I had to take a taxi. This was the reason I could not enjoy a breakfast, too. The rooms are clean and have a nice view over the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great neighborhood if you are not interested in sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: Dashkina
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit in Istanbul and I loved this hotel and the area around. The rooms are spacious and typical standard Marriott/Renaissance rooms. The view on the sea is spectacular. The food is great. Wonderful quiet neighborhood around. If you are to explore the city this is indeed quite far away, and with Istanbul traffic it could be quite long. There are hotel shuttles just a couple of times a day to the downtown - please note that you need to sign up at reception, otherwise you have a little chance of getting a vacant seat on the bus. The hotel is close to the airport, but you don't hear any noise. The famous kebab house Beytsi is only 10 minutes taxi drive away. I would definitely recommend this hotel for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BogdanTTudor
Reviews.Content: This place is looking great outside, the rooma are excelent maintained and the whole place shows quality. The only downside are location and sometimes the staff. Received a two beds room when requested queen with no possibility to change. Promise to come later to join the beds and need to call again to request it. The shuttle bus is most of the time full and needs one day in advance booking. The location is far from the center: 20Euro cab or 45 minutes walk plus train, but it is in a nice neighbourhood and on the way to train you can find a number of good, where locals eat restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a gorgeous setting”
Reviews.Author: crabtownc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the airport and a half-hour ride from downtown (free shuttle bus 2 x /day), but the setting on the Marmara Sea is gorgeous and there is no airport noise. The lounge areas are extensive and classy. Rooms are clean, calm, and roomy. The staff is friendly, prompt, courteous, and helpful (we arrived very early, but were given a room shortly after arrival). There are restaurants on the premises (our dinner overlooking the pool was delightful: Turkish cuisine). I would highly recommend this hotel, despite its not being in the city.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mancho
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good...nice area where is located and just in front of Marmara see, nice swimming pool and great fitness facilities with saunas, hamman and changing rooms separated for man and woman..and nice indoor and outdoor swimming pools... Great security, great people who works there. Need to improve: No concierge services at nights and people in the front desk don't know or are afraid to recommend restaurants... There are so many places in Istanbul to go..that must be very difficult...but a guide will be a help. Other eare to improve is people with more English... specially in the restaurants area...English is a common problem all over the city... is hard to find people with English, French or Spanish to receive help...rare to find English speaking people. If you are for business in the west part or airport area... this hotel is perfect...if your business are in Taksim or Asian side...do not stay in this area...The old town (Sultahamet) can take 10 min in a taxi in the night..but daytime can be 45 min... Taksim square can be 15-20 min in the night..daytime over an hour. I'll stay here again for business in that area... was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “not recommendable due bad service”
Reviews.Author: mark_bennebroek
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel to anybody due to the service I experienced last Friday. Ordering roomservice, it took 1 hour before the order was served. According the menu (and confirmed when making the order by staff) it should be delivered within 30 minutes.....or it's free. Part of the order was a bottle of champagne. Instead of delivering this bottle for free, it just would not be served! Even when confronting the manager on duty with this, he would not live up to the promises made. Fixing mistakes is when you find out the level of service. In this case I found out that Renaissance Polat Istanbuls management disregards their own service standards over a nice bottle of champagne.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: EnergizeMe
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at Renaissance Polat, and I have nothing to complain about. Friendly staff, good service, everything is how you expect it to be in a hotel of this class. After checking out, I realised I forgot to mention that I had taken 2 items from the mini bar after the last time they made the inventory, went back to the front desk to pay for them, but the receptionist did not have me pay: as I said, friendly service. The location at less than a 10 minutes drive from the airport makes it the perfect hotel for business meetings and quick in-and-out trips to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful area!”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie A
Reviews.Content: The Polat is located between the Ataturk airport and tthe city center. It is about 20-30 minutes to the Old Town area where the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia are located. The hotel has a free shuttle several times a day or the train is within reasonable walking distance. There is a lovely seaside walk to a small fishing village of Yesilkoy located next to the hotel. As for the Polat, their prices are outrageously high in their restaurants and their policy of no outside food or drink can be a problem if you are not on business expenses and are here for any length of time. If you bring any water or food into the hotel, make sure it is in your luggage or backpack or they will treat you very unkindly. Check in can be very slow and our reservations were "lost" even though they were made in person at the hotel a month prior to our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for airport but not 5*”
Reviews.Author: HellsBells055
Reviews.Content: I stay here about 3 nights a month for business. This hotel is very close to the airport. Check in can be very slow and the staff not overly friendly. Rooms are large and the beds are very comfortable with nice linen. The coffee making facilities are awful. The cups NEVER get changed simply wiped clean so I never use them. Their is no milk only coffee mate. The bathroom is dire! No dont panic you havent aged a 100 years, its just a very bad light in the mirror!!! The bathroom isnt clean enough, its very dated and desperatly needs re fitting. they provide slippers and robes however which is nice. The air con works well but the windows dont open which I always think means the rooms never get aired as they should. The room service is hit and miss. The quality can be poor. The pool is nice to sunbathe around and the business center good.

Reviews.Title: “expensive, nice hotel but the staff is not friendly at all”
Reviews.Author: TravelLoveMe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very expensive. I like the location which is near to the seaside. It is also near to the train station which easy to get to the city. The breakfast is good. The staff in front desk is not friendly and sometimes just not friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not great. Kind of old and tired.”
Reviews.Author: lorraine6225
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just OK. It is a rather old and tired hotel. The rooms have been redone and are pretty nice except the bnathrooms are old and moldy. It would have been nice to get rid of the mold in the bathroom at the same time they replaced the beds and TVs. Shame becaiuse otherwise the rooms are really nice, nice view, great TV. Nice linens and bed. They have a nice pillow menu but the staff can't deliver if you order pillows. They just get confused. The pool is really nice. The restaurants are nice but have an 80s feel. Serviice is ok, staff don't speak English well. Food is very good. Overall an OK hotel. Good, not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but far from tourist spots”
Reviews.Author: H3LLBLAZ3R
Reviews.Content: I was there last year in the annual conference of our Bank, and it was one good place to be. The Hotel was beautiful but it was situated pretty far off form the tourist spots like the Grand Bazaar or Blue Mosque. Taxi to these places costed about 35 liras which is roughly around 1200 Indian rupees. Over all the hotel was very nice and facilities were good. The breakfast spread really deserves a mention. All in all good for a business traveller but if are taking your family on a trip then settle for a hotel near the tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jess h
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, it has everything you need. I done some shopping here, swimming, had a full body massage, got my hair done, Tanned in the sun & had all our meals here. Big shopping centres close by and Ataturk airport is just around the corner. Our room was modern and clean, everything worked !! All the staff are very professional and helpful. The champion restaurant is AMAZING !!! The food and the people are fantastic. Our food was delicious, the staff are friendly and the WET CHOCALATE CAKE is so good!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sinanyalova
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Polat for a weekend vacation with my daughter and wife.The hotel is in a very nice and quiet location and close to the airport,one of the nicest locations in Istanbul.The staff were very helpful and friendly.The rooms are quite spacious,big enough for the three of us ,with a nice sea view.We stayed one night in a standard room and wanted ,also, to try the garden rooms.They are ideal if you want to relax.While i and my daughter enjoyed the spa (one of the biggest ones that i have seen amongst the city hotels in the world),my wife spent most of her time in the swimming pool (very big pool for a city hotel).The hotel is by the sea side,however the sea was not suitable for swimming.Unfortunately,the main restaurant Daphne was closed at the time and we had to have dinner at the fish restaurant which was very good (The portions could be a bit bigger ). We are hoping to go there again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: VIG001
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family when the flight was landed at Istanbul for technical failure. Hotel, close to the airport, has all amenities for comfort. Staff was very courteous to help all people for a massive bulk check-in. Restaurant has good dine-in options. Hotel houses a good banquet and a business center

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport and good for business. Not for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: KarenLen
Reviews.Content: This is a quality hotel and I would recommend it for business meetings due to its class and proximity to the airport. It has the best gym I have seen in a hotel. It did fail the mini bar test with drinks being ludicrously expensive. If you are looking for this as a base to see Istanbul I would not recommend it as it is somewhat isolated.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, short distance from airport”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Falch
Reviews.Content: Exclusive interior, efficient staff, great outdoor restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice surrounding”
Reviews.Author: OkanSoysal
Reviews.Content: A good choice of having meetings out off the chaotic city center. Very near to the airport but not an airport hotel. Very friendly staff (except the security - nothing dramatic). Consider it for your international meetings at the region. The hotel rooms may need some renovation in the near future. Both side of the hotel have great view; the Marmara Sea and the AtatÃ¼rk airport ( do not worry no airplane noises). Great outdoor pool to relax between meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy my stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieNarelle
Reviews.Content: Have been going to Turkey now for sixteen months and generally start or emd my trip at The Polat. it is close to the airport with a shuttle service each hour. Also regular shuttle service to Sultanahment and Takim areas. If working, stay on the club floor, and if vacation, stay in the pool rooms. Lovely walk along the water to the village. Everyone from the doorman to reception to housekeeping is friendly and service orientated. Breakfast service can be hit or miss in the restaurant. Club is always quiet and peaceful. Regular, reppeat customer - says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for purpose...and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTam82
Reviews.Content: I was here on a business trip and have stayed here before. I think the rooms were nice and comfortable. They were cleaned daily and the air conditioning was put on so you dont come back to a stuffy room, even though can be quite chilly after being on all day. I used the internet in the room which worked with no problem and there is an iron and ironing board in the room I stayed in and a safe. There is a good selection for breakfast and had dinner in the hotel a few nights too. The staff were nice and helpful. The only thing which I think needs to be improved is the speed of checking in and out, this can be quite timely. But the reception staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away if you can”
Reviews.Author: rantati7
Reviews.Content: I just checked out from Polat Renaissance. Stay elsewhere if you can. There are much better alternatives close to the airport. There was a hassle while checking in (no reservation in their system which in btw not connected to Marriott's online reservation system), there was hassle while staying at the hotel and there was a hasssle while checking out (extra charges). To top up the experience the Polat Taxi which has some linkage to the hotel did the classical taxi scam: metre not working (even though it clearly was) and trying to charge 20 THL for the 3 kilometre and 5 minute trip. It costs around 30 THL from the airport to centre of Istanbul which is 30 - 60 minutes drive depending on the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but definitely not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: twoteckels
Reviews.Content: Fairly tight security. We had a room on 12th floor - decent size but very worn. Bathroom in particular was shabby. No free internet or breakfast. Food in the hotel restaurants was good but expensive. Staff friendly. Convenient to the airport and there was a free shuttle to and from, but too far from the tourist sights and no shuttle into the city, so your choices were taxi or public bus. Renaissance is supposedly a non-smoking hotel, but on the Friday night we were there, heavy cigarette smell coming up below somewhere. Would not stay there again - we expected better for what we were charged.

Reviews.Title: “good location between airport and main town”
Reviews.Author: econokal
Reviews.Content: stayed on the 20th floor with beautiful views of the sea and a great room with a wonderful bed! noise is a bit of an issue as I could hear people talking in the room next door bathroom adequate but bath on the small side breakfast and lunch provided by the hotel during the congress was very tasty and of good variety and they made great macaroons and biscuits for during the congress teas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not value for money”
Reviews.Author: dmarkstravels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a business trip in June. The check in was smooth and the desk staff were very helpful. The room was clean and almost chilly when we arrived. We stayed in one of the standard garden rooms on the b2 floor by the pool. The room was nice, although there was not enough space to put all of out cloths away, only 2 small drawers inside the wardrobe. The bed was wonderful, no complaints there. We did have trouble with the Internet, there is no wireless in the rooms outside the main floors and the wired Internet was hit or miss, we had to call the desk and have someone troubleshoot the problem and even when it came back it left again the next day. Not sure what was going on, but this was an issue. Room service was nice, prompt, and the food was always good. The restaurant has some wonderful food, but pricy as you would expect. Breakfast was 45 TL and lunch buffet was 98 TL. Good food but over priced. The major issues we had with the stay were with service. The first main issues was running out of toilet paper. At this type of hotel, and for the price, you should never run out of anything. Next was a problem I had with a taxi driver. I wanted to report a complaint for a taxi driver that tried to scam me. The lady at the counter tried to call once, received a busy signal and said I would have go come back later. In was there on business for meetings and trying to report this during a break. Maybe I am out of line, but I felt the hotel should have taken this up on my behalf. I could return to provide details and sign whatever statement required, but I didn't receive any assistance on this. It's disappointing because if these events aren't reported and followed up on it will happen again. The last problem was with the shower. It leaked horribly. The supplied mat and both hand towels were not enough to keep the water at bay after just 1 of us showered, let alone both of us. I'm not particularly fond of standing in water while brushing my teeth and shaving in the morning. The hotel and the staff are nice, but overall the hotel is just not up to standard for the price. I expect, and have received, better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Souless but functional”
Reviews.Author: pgwswth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is out near the airport in a residential area but a half hour taxi ride from the sites (negotiate on price or get a taxi with a meter - will cost ~Â£15 each way). It is a large tower block and you get a view of the airport or a view of the container ships moored out to see. I was given a smoking room initially which smelt awful. The rooms are standard chain business hotel type. Staff are responsive but difficult to force a smile out of them. Good conference facilities but not a good base for tourists. My standard room was Â£250 a night with tax but worth less than half that in my view.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Prices for drinks and meals very expensive”
Reviews.Author: dolcevita14
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Renaissance Polat Hotel last month. We had two adjoining rooms for for our teenage sons. The rooms were excellent and the hotel was very clean. The service was excellent. The gym in the hotel is super with great facilities. The breakfast was excellent with something for everyone. The position of this hotel is great for the airport but not for Istanbul.The hotel does provide a shuttle bus twice a day but it takes at least 40 mins along a busy route to reach the centre of Istanbul. The drinks and food in the hotel were very expensive by most hotel standards. It didn't feel like a holiday hotel and is much more suited as a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fine for an airport hotel BUT..”
Reviews.Author: Vintagebabe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recenly and I think the hotel has some issues. Do thay view themselves as an airport stopover catering to aircrews and one night stays for passengers or do they see themselves as a luxury family hotel for visitors to Istambul? I don't think tey will ever get it right until they define their market! The good- rooms are nice and the view of the sea is lovely. The proximety to the airport makes it a quick trip between flights. It is, howevwr, a 30- 60 plus minute drive to the city depending on traffic and 30-35 TL one way. If they are catering to the airport crowd, they have a problem with the wireless internet- 12TL/24 hrs which often cuts out making work a nightmare. There is a landliine which is much better. They did not charge for the wireless whn I checked out but I wish I had been warned as I wasted a lot of time. In addition, I too was placed in the garden annex..a trip to the main hotel as outlined by the previous writer. This is really very inconvenient for the business traveller but might be ideal for a family in the summer- a quick trip to the pool without walking though the lobby. The execise rooms looked great. The spa had a long list of treatments but I think this might be more focused at people who stay more than a da. The breakfast was great but other meals were expensive and just so so. There is a great lounge/ bar for drinks which was ideal for business travellers who are travelling as a group. In summary, I think if the hotel defined what it wished to be, it would be able to provide a product which would be compatable with 2 very different markets.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: asultana123
Reviews.Content: When I booked the hotel on hotels.com it showed me beautiful pictures of a a hotel overlooking the sea of marmara. The suite i picked was pool view. Little did I know what they mean by pool view is taking you for a walk through their five star building out the back passing the pool and into their motel type of building which is not attached to their hotel at all. It was raining when we got back from our tour and had to walk in the rain pool side slipping and sliding through the water to get to our room my six year old daughter was freezing as it was cold and all her clothes were soaked by the time we made it to the room. When I complained at the front desk they said well thats what you paid for . I was very upset because no where during the booking did it say this was a separate building. They told me my reservation said so I walked all the way back to my room again in the rain and found a copy and then walked back to show them and they still said they could do nothing. finally someone in the back office came upfront her name was medine and she was helpful and agreed that the booking was misleading and then moved us to a room in the main building this was now at 8pm and our checkout was the next day. if only they moved us sooner we would not have to waste four hours arguing with them. Thanks medine for your help but we will never come back to your hotel where everyone but you was very mean and arrogant. Even the bell boy who came to get out luggage the next day rolled his eyes at me when i asked him if he could wait a min while i zipped up one of my bags. ahhh horrible service. To top it all off the mattress was like sleeping on a cardboard. These people have a crappy hotel and it is no where near five star and the service is -5. Never never never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Five-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nassermkaplan
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed for 6 nights (Fri 01 Apr - Thu 07 Apr 2011) in the double room No 1202. The room was clean with a marvelous sea view and comfortable bed. Room service was quick and very good. Staff everywhere was professional and friendly. There were 6 lifts with panorama views. The Gym was excellent. The buffet breakfast in Daphne restaurant was fantastic. The hotel had 6 restaurants; however we had dinner in the Marmara fish (twice) and Daphne Grill (twice) restaurants where the food was just perfect and good value for money. There were free bus shuttles to and from both the airport and the city centre, however please do reserve the seats and collect your tickets 24 hours ahead from the reception. The city centre shuttle usually stops in both Eminonu (the historic city) and Taksim square & Istiklal Street. The supermarket (shopping world) was around the corner (hotel's west) for quick shopping if required. The new Atakoy shopping centre was NOT far away from the hotel; you can walk (20 min) or take a taxi. Other nearby shopping areas were within walking distances in the way to Yersykoy (hotel's west) and Yersykurt (hotel's east) train stations. You can also go to Eminonu either by bus No 81 or train (Sirkeci) buying 1.75TL ticket where you can walk around in the historic city or walk to Taksim square over Galata Bridge. It was fabulous five-star stay and I strongly recommend Renaissance Polat Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JP-ontour
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with very nice room and all amenities you need on a trip. The room was clean with a comfortable bed and nice shower. Not only a Minibar with drinks and snacks/chocolate but also a drawyer with other necessities. It is located directly at the sea which gives a nice view, but does not look like a beach hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lenic-helenic
Reviews.Content: Well-designed hotel, very beautiful, with much entertainment, sauna, bath, swimming pool, jacuzzi, gym...all u need. and if u have the top floors room - u will enjoy marmara sea, its so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Layover”
Reviews.Author: triwinner
Reviews.Content: I had two stays at this hotel in a two week period. It has a very convenient location near the airport. The used were very clean and nice and well maintained. The Executive Room was well stocked and the service there was excellent. Restaurant food and drink prices were very high. I used the gym twice and it very large and as nice as any hotel I have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel choice near Ataturk airport - esp for Business travelers”
Reviews.Author: vcchicago
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a conference that was held in the hotel. The hotel is very near the Ataturk International airport. From one side of the hotel you get a view of the airport and the city, which is splendid (you get an idea of how many flights Turkish airlines operates) and from the other side you get a view of the Bosphorous channel and the line of ships constantly crossing it. The hotel has very good facilities - a fantastic gym that is also open to non-hotel members so does not feel very private. A good choice of restaurants. I had breakfast included in my room rate and it was a feast each day. There is a Royal China restaurant on the premises and an American-styled sports bar next door. There is also a nice, convenience / grocery store literally around the corner. I found basic items like water, soft drinks and beer to be atrociously priced - between 7-12 euros, so picked up some of this from the convenience store nearby. Taxi fare from IST airport to the hotel is about 12 TL. It is a bit of a pain getting from the hotel into the city if you intend to do so but if your business is in and around the airport, this is a good hotel to stay in. One pleasant experience I had is that I was surprised to find cake and white wine in my room on the evening of my birthday with a card signed by the General Manager. That was quite a positive and personal experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & Location not that bad”
Reviews.Author: ajphilly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in October 2010. The hotel is very close to the airport but it does not run a shuttle. The cab cost us 15 Lira to or from the hotel to or from the airport. The hotel is in a residential part of town and there are not many restaurants nearby. We found a few restaurants near the Yesilyurt train station. The train station is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel and the train takes about 30 minutes to the center of Istanbul. It only costs 1.5 Lira. We found it very convenient to use the train station to visit the historical sites in Istanbul. There are two â€œbarsâ€� near the hotel (one next door and one across the street). They do not serve alcohol but they cater to hookah smokers. There are a lot of young people and it was fun to get snacks and drink Turkish tea. The rooms are very nice and it is a standard Marriott. We found that the staff was slow to respond when we called them asking for more towels. Also, the checkout process takes a very long time (around 10 minutes). As mentioned by other travelers, the food and drinks are very expensive in the hotel. It costs 8 Lira for a Turkish coffee. Overall, we liked the hotel and did not mind the location because the train was easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mukeshbharti
Reviews.Content: Staff is unhelpful and worst of all they seem to be seletively eager to serve certain types of customers. They may actually ignore you. Dont expect a warm welcome in any case. They have small cramped rooms in a separate facility from the main building which will make you feel like living in servant's quarter. Ofcourse they will not change your room if you asked. I suggest you make sure you will not be given one of those rooms at the time of making a reservation if possible-they are patronizingly called Garden Rooms- there seems to be a store rooms for chairs and tables and what not right outside my window!Paid for internet connection and the connection is pathetic - too many users sharing the same link. Resturant food and drinks are expensive and definitely does not justify the quality or quantity. There are many other much better hotels in both Istanbul and Ankara.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: attbgodzi
Reviews.Content: Went during the summer months. Air conditioner was not nearly cool enough. It felt hot and humid in the room. Staffs were not very well trained. They over charged us for our rooms. Luckily we checked the bill the evening before checkout because it took them hours to make the corrective adjustments. I asked the staff to send a few postcards out for me and they charge more than double of what the stamps cost. And the postcards still have not reached its destination after 1 month. The location of the hotel is horrible for people travelling for leisure. The free shuttle of the hotel was good but not adequate. Starts too late and ends too early. I would not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel and perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelledladybird
Reviews.Content: This hotet is perfect! The shuttle bus took 5 mins or so to the hotel. It is a stunning contemporary design. We were on the Club level and checked in at the club lounge - where they had started serving cocktails and hot snacks. This was so delighful, easy, perfect - ! A simple check in, and the supervisor on the club lounge organised our luggage to be brought up, whilst we had cool drinks and snacks. The outdoor pool is enormous and does not feel crowded even when there are many guests inside. The indoor pool is lovely! Room services prices are reasonable and overall a lovely lovely hotel. The staff aim to please and location perfect. We went on the shuttle bus which is a lovely journey to the city centre - which makes you realise how lucky you are not to be staying in this hustle, bustle which is tiring from just observing. A truely relaxing stay and a wonderful hotel - I would suggest club level. Oh and the breakfast at the restaurant Daphne - was lovely - felt truely 5*. A very 5* hotel. Perfect for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel but expensive drinks”
Reviews.Author: cappa9
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay here. Hotel and rooms are good, quality bedding and fixtures. Pool with lots of sunbeds. Dangerous flooring around pool when wet, loads of adults & kids slipping over. Had side seaview room. No balconys @ this hotel. Cleaned properly each day. Luxury bedding with even a pillow menu! Food limited and expensive. The worse part of our long weekend was the 500% mark up in drink prices!! Hotel prices are always expensive but this was a rip off. 2 glasses of orange juice cost Â£18!! So beware. There is no beach at all so staying around the pool is the only option. More suited to a business trip as there were alot of men in suits!! Did have a pleasant stay and would recommend but the Marriott needs to sort out its drinks prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for relaxation after a long air trip”
Reviews.Author: steelerfans
Reviews.Content: We selected the Renaissance Polat as a one-night stopover for a good rest after a long air trip to Istanbul before staying in the old city for the remainder of the trip. We wanted something close to the hotel with decent relaxation amenities and the hotel was just what we needed. The staff was professional and attentive, the room was comfortable and spacious and the pool was very nce with a great view of the Marmara. We ate at the seafood restaurant â€“ lovely outdoor setting, fine food & service. As to value, we utilized Marriott points; but I checked the internet rates (about $220 US) and in my opinion the hotel was comparable with this rate. This was a very nice hotel for the purpose used but I would not recommend it as a base for touring the city; it would be an unnecessary hassle and waste of time to try to commute into the main touring areas from this location.

Reviews.Title: “1st time but last time!”
Reviews.Author: Roula_jo
Reviews.Content: The hotel as everyone said is very near to the airport(the Ataturk Airport) since there is another airport (Sabiha) which is very far away (it might take 2-3 hours according to the traffic). -When we arrived to the hotel no 1 came to take our luggage and we with the taxi driver took them out plus the kids had to stay for more than 5 minutes outside until my husband took a turn to the reception and asked them to send someone to pick the luggage! -The rooms are small and our room smells smoke, I asked the reception to change it and they told me this is the only available sea view room, the positive thing is they sent someone to spray it and called us to be sure everything is ok......though the smell didn't go (if ur allergic or can't bare the smell of smoke be sure to ask for a non smoking room) -The AC was not working properly and we asked them to fix it, they did but still wasn't very cold! -The hotel is very far from everything, there is a shuttle that goes to Taksim Street 3 times a day and brings u back twice at 2, 5 pm so we used to go with the shuttle at 10:30 and come back with a taxi (always ask the taxi how much it will cost before u ride cause unfortunately some taxis just take a very long way and u'll pay 50-60Liras! it must take around 30-35Liras, u can take also the public bus (T72) though we never tried it but we were told we can. -we stayed at the weekend and there were 2 weddings, at the beginning we were excited to see a Turkish wedding but the music was so loud since we were at the 3rd floor plus there is a beach stage near the hotel and they turn the music very loud until a late night....this was a bit annoying for us(others might like it!) -The positive things in the hotel are: the stuff are very friendly and nice, the sea view from the room is beautiful, the room has a coffee machine and an iron board but each day they take the mugs and never bring them back and don't refill until we ask them to do so! A 5 star hotel......mmmm....I doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Missing Luggage”
Reviews.Author: eriqua
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived my husband complimented me on my planning skills as we had an early flight out the next morning and the airport is nearby and the ocean view from our room was lovely. However, our happiness soon faded when an hour later the bellboy still hadn't arrived with our luggage. Obviously we were really worried and we had called the reception desk several times. The bellboy finally came up but with the wrong luggage! We asked to go down with him to look in their luggage room but he insisted we stay in our room and wait. He then went back down and came up again with the wrong luggage again! We came down with him finally and looked in the luggage room and our luggage wasn't there. Obviously we were getting really nervous now and seriously wasting our time on our last day of vacation. Finally, an hour and 45 minutes later, he found our bags. We saw they had labeled them with the wrong room number so assume they were in someone else's room. Now, mistakes happen, but I can't believe we never got an apology from management with such a drastic mistake. And whose bags did they keep bringing up to us? It was just very poorly managed and I hope no one else ever has the same experience. On a positive side we had a nice walk into the little town area there and had tea on colorful bean bag chairs on the grass next to the beach at a place looked like it was frequented mainly by locals. Would have liked to have had that extra almost two hours back to have walked around a bit more though.

Reviews.Title: “great view - nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Beachbilly
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the airport. (We were going to squeeze in a trip to Ephesus (definitely a must see).) The views the sea are spectacular, but the location is really out of the way except that the airport is ten minutes away. There is nothing in the neighborhood. The included breakfast is fine. The rooms are what you expect from a Renaissance. We had a few problems, like bad smoke smell in a non-smoking room and weak AC in another room. Hotel was not terrifically responsive to our problem. Also there seemed to be no functioning consierge help.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from the rush”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Gussie
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is a great hotel if you don't mind being a fair way out of town. The shuttle service helps to overcome this, but there are only 3 per day into the city (see the website for times) and they do not run late at night. We paid 22Lira to get into the Grand Bazaar, but I guess it would be quite a lot more if you were going right across to Taksim and through the horrendous traffic. If you are a little more adventurous however you can catch the train from/to Sirkeci for 1.25Lira to within half a mile and get a cab from there. We did it without any hassle at all and saved ourselves probably 30Lira each time. The rooms are standard Marriott ones with all main amenities, including the fantastic beds that they have. As noted elsewhere on TA though, the cost of the add-ons is very steep. The spa downstairs seemed quite busy as we passed it on our way to the pool, but we didn't partake in a visit. The seafood restaurant has a lovely terrace overloooking the water and the price of the fresh fish is reasonable although they get you with what is charged for drinks. My wife and I spent about 200 Lira on quite a lavish dinner, but this would have been twice that in London or New York. The food cost was less than half of that amount. The outdoor pool area was fantastic, with dozens of sun lounges and plenty of side areas to find some peace. This was especially necessary as the weather was in the high 20's and the pool gave a great respite from the madness of the city and to cool our tired bodies. We were happy to stay here, but if you are coming to Istanbul to see a lot in a short time it may pay to be closer to town, however if you don't mind a 20-30 minute commute into the sights then you can't really go wrong. BG

Reviews.Title: “Read this before booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MPF_Stockholm
Reviews.Content: In writing this report I would like to be as honest and up front as I can be. I would like to cover the positives as well as the negatives. Firstly I would like to say they I did not book this hotel myself as I was attending an international conference which was being held at the hotel. The positives: Location to the airport - 5 to 10 minutes away. Free transfers to and from the airport. Free transferes in to and out of the city (European side). Times etc are available on request. Room service good. Rooms clean albeit on the small side for a 5 star hotel. 2 swimming pools. Restuarants and shops inside the hotel very nice. Staff friendly and helpful. Business centre located on C floor above the lobby. ATM available in the lobby. Left luggage facility. Security was very good. Bags and guests are checked when they enter the hotel. Negatives Food and drinks very expensive. A can (33cl) of coke 12TL (6 Euro/Â£6/60SEK) the same can of pepsi can be bought around the corner in the local supermarket for 0.89TL. When sitting next to the pool we took with us a 2 litre bottle of coke which casts about 1.49TL from the local store and took our ice bucket from the room with us. Ice machines can be found on every floor and they are located in the fire escape! We then asked the bar for 2 glasses and we enjoyed ice cold drinks at the pool for a fraction of the price. Internet is not free. Internet can be obtained via cable, wifi or through the TV but at 8 euros a day (16TL/Â£8/80SEK) I thought this was very expensive. When I wanted to check-in for my return flight I asked if there was a facility to do this and was informed I could use the business centre. I checked in online but when I came to print the boarding passes the printer was out of toner. They told me if I emailed the passes to myself we could go to another business centre to print them off. Before doing this I thought I had better check I could access my email address. Unfortunately the computers would not allow me access to hotmail/msn etc. I couldn't enter my work email address either. eventually they found some toner and I was able to proceed. Distance from the city. You are quite some distance from the city centre. A taxi will take you at least 25 minutes and you can expect to pay 20-30 euros each way. The free transfer mentioned above only runs during the day. Money. Having been to Turkey before I brought euros with me. I visited Alanya before and everything was done in euros. Instanbul is different they prefer Turkish Lira and I found this a bind as I was having to do 3 conversions in my head everytime I wanted to buy something or pay for something. The room. Try and get a sea view. The first few floors are available for those of us who smoke. The hotel is like a triangle but one side looks directly at the airport. The sea views are better although there are hundreds of ships just off the coast waiting to transit the Bosphorus. There is a strong odour late at night. One evening the smell was so strong coming through the airconditioning that we were both woken up by the smell. I think this is about all I have to add. Overall I enjoyed my stay at the hotel but found that it wasn't up to 5 star standards and food and drink was very expensive at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff with free shuttle service to the city centre”
Reviews.Author: experienceitthere
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. Although, not one of the most luxurious 5* hotels that I have stayed at. The staff were very helpful and friendly. There are a number of choices of restaurants and a beautiful lounge area. Despite the fact that it is located 30mins from the 'Old city' of Istanbul, there are free shuttle services that run 3 times a day to the city. However, the last shuttle that comes back is around 5.30pm which is a little early. A taxi back to the hotel is around 30 lira. We actually took trains a few times. The train station is a 5 minute walk from the hotel and takes you straight into the city for 1.50 lira per person!! We bumped into the owner of this hotel - very friendly and chatted to us whilst we waited for our shuttle service to Ataturk Airport (which is only 5-20 minutes away). Overall, a pleasant experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL WITH FANTASTIC STAFF”
Reviews.Author: mittelmans
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with a world-class staff. I was there for a meeting and got delayed there due to the volcanic ash issue in Europe. The staff bent over backwards to accommodate us during the delay. The rooms are spacious by European standards; clean, comfortable beds and a great view. The food in the restaurants was great and very reasonable. The fitness center in the hotel is, by far, the very best I've every seen in any hotel - to include the indoor and outdoor pools. This is a great value for the price - I HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel....a bit far from tourist attractions though”
Reviews.Author: mnkmaguire
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable and the staff very friendly. The gymnasium on the bottom floor is outstanding. They have classes, a weight room, 2 squash courts and lots of cardio equipment. An indoor and out door pool. The indoor pool has 3 http://cdn.tripadvisor.com/img2/sprites/ratings-v3.pnghot tubs. We eat at Marriotts sports bar, Champions, descent food, though a bit pricey. There is a shuttle service to the Sultanamet area or you can get a cab for about 27TL - 20-25 min ride. The hotel is near the airport right on the water so if you're here to vacation/sight see this hotel would be a bit out of the way for you. For a business traveller it would be perfect. The club level offers a private room for free drinks and food most of the day. Free internet can be had there with a printer. Wired internet in our room is 5TL/24hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel does not deserve five stars”
Reviews.Author: pinhigh9497
Reviews.Content: I booked a "luxury" standard room with view over the swimming pool. The room was at ground level but I could not open the windows or a door to go to the pool. It felt a bit claustrophobic to me. The air conditioning system did not work and the air was dumpy and hot. A technician came quickly but he could not do anything about it. I had important negotiations the next day so I booked a one day upgrade / entrance to the "Executive Club" on the 21st floor for 65 Euros. This was not worth it! The view is magnificent but the food is lousy and, although Turkish wine is excellent, only juices and beer were available. During our negotiations, an employee was vacuing the place with a machine making noise like a jet. We tried to stop him and come back later but no success! In some hotels an upgrade to club level is great value. The best example is the Mandarin in Singapore. But not the Polat in Istanbul. Positive point: the fitness club is great. I will not come back here. My complaints at the reception did not result in an excuse or refund.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Comfy Bed, great views, taxi ride from anywhere”
Reviews.Author: bon23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the Marriott chain and is one of the best outside of Europe or the U.S. I don't sleep well in hotels but the bed in my club floor room is the best ever! THe views are great from both sides of the hotel - I enjoy watching the planes at the airport (a 10 minute ride away - and I can't hear them at all) but colleagues on the other side are enjoying a sea view. Some folks say it's too far out but it's a 20 TY (14 US$) taxi ride from anywhere and it's quite out on the edge of town and makes getting to the airport easier for an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great (American Style) Hotel, but lost in the sub-suburbs of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: cx20009
Reviews.Content: (January 2010) I instantly felt at ease when coming into this hotel. The lobby is nice, but this doesn't really impress me since I am not sleeping in the lobby. As with many American-styled hotels in Istanbul, I found the metal detector was always in the lobby. The first few times I passed through this I found it strange, but soon became accustomed to it. The hotel itself is modern, updated, pricey (but this is standard for Renaissance Hotels). It is also in the middle of nowhere-- at least from a tourist's perspective. To reach this hotel, you must take the regional rail from central Istanbul to Yesilyurt. It's a short 10-minute walk from the station to the hotel. Watch out for hidden prices. It was free to use the pool, but you had to have some sort of bathing cap. If you don't bring one of your own it'll cost you TYL3. It's not a huge deal, but worth noting. Internet is not free, costing (I believe) around EUR5,00 per day. I cannot rate the internet as we did not use it. There is a table-sort of thing in the room with ridiculously high prices for things, but as I am guessing this hotel is aimed toward fly-in business folks and not budget-minded folks, I was not surprised by this. I can't comment on the television or anything related to it. It stayed 'off' the entire time we were there. There is a free hotel shuttle to the airport, but it only leaves every thirty minutes, and you MUST reserve in advance. Also, it only runs a specified time, and outside of this, you'll need to take a taxi to the airport, costing around TYL15. With so much to see, do and experience in downtown Istanbul, there really is no reason to use this hotel as a tourist other than as the last night before going to the airport. As a side note, there is also a Courtyard with almost the exact same amenities (including hotel shuttle) but at a much lower price. I believe it is the next regional rail station, but did not stay there, so I cannot comment on this other than seeing it listed on the Marriott website.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: highprofilesummit
Reviews.Content: I am a business summit organiser and have worked with many of Londons top venues and NOTHING compares to the experiance I have just had at the Polat. The staff were on hand 24/7 to assist me NOTHING was TOO much trouble. Maybe a little on the pricey side but can definately say you get what you pay for and it was money well spent. We have just confirmed an additional 2 events at the hotel and would not hesitate to recommend holding your next meeting here. Facilities are second to none and only 15/20 mins from the airport. One warning - if you are staying here allow at least 10 mins to use the lifts if you are on the upper floors!!!! They take forever.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but far away from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: littev0ices
Reviews.Content: I'm a Marriott Platinum member (75+ nights/year) so my experience might not be representative of normal travellers.I spent New year 2008/9 at the Istanbul Renaissance with my wife. Prior to arriving I'd communicated with the conceirge to arrange for a set of welcome gifts for my wife (a meat selection etc) and was very happy to have them waiting for us upon checking in, as well as room on the club level with a nice sea view. I believe this is a great hotel, with nice rooms, a good bathroom and a lovely view of the sea. In fact I think it would be a great place for a wedding or a relaxing holiday with side-trips into Istanbul for a few days out of 7. Transport-wise it was only a cheap cab ride to the airport (beware of the cabs as typical for Turkey, we had one attempted cheating which the hotel resolved and picking up a cab from the hotel to the airport once the driver used the night rate). From the airport you can get public transport into the city centre, though the hotel also offered a minibus into the centre a few times a day. In essence this was the main problem, we stayed at the hotel as we like Marriotts and used points to reduce the cost of the stay - however the Marriott in Istanbul was in the wrong location for a tourist, hence staying at a Marriott chain hotel. In hindsight we wasted 1.5 hours each day getting between the hotel and sights, so, it probably wasn't the right choice for a tourist. There weren't that many places nearby to eat, but we had room service one night and it was very good - not cheap, but not as expensive as Marriotts can sometimes be - the portions were also reasonable sizes and the food was very Turkish (better value and quality than many of the tourist restaurants in Sultanahmet). Breakfast was a good selection, with a nice view of the hotel pool and sea. With this being a country with a long history of Islamic influence you might expect no pork, but whilst the buffet had beef/chicken sausages they also had bacon. There was also a Turkish breakfast option in the buffet. The biggest disappointment was that the club lounge was closed from December 4th 2008 until January 28th 2009. The hotel had a very low occupancy and although the lounge was supposedly closed for 'renovations' - as I was on the club floor and you could see into the lounge from above (a nice setup actually, the lounge itself looked lovely and on two floors) and it was 'as is' with no changes underway... likely closed due to low capacity. In return for the closure club floors were given access to the normal hotel bars with complimentary drinks/breakfast/nibbles, which might be better to some (the full breakfast buffet was appreciated by my wife and I!) - but, its not quite the same as wandering into a pleasant quiet lounge right next to your room. I've overlooked the closed lounge and the transportation (as we chose the hotel anyway knowing it was far away) for my score, but beware if staying in winter you might want to check if the lounge is open.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, far from Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: FromNYCtoTheWorld
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel with a great pool, views of the Sea, and comfortable large rooms. However, you are quite a distance from the center of Istanbul. There is a frequent shuttle to the center of the city, or you can take a taxi. It is not ideal, and to do it again, I would stay in the center of Istanbul. Although the hotel itself was great.

Reviews.Title: “No airconditioning”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: Airconditioning is just warm air!! Room is nice with small bath. Far from sights. Taxis are expensive. Nice big pool and restaurants. Bad value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, comfortable and great base for exploring Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: fahrin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. After reading the reviews we thought this might just be for people who needed an airport hotel but to our delight it made no difference - we might as well have stayed closer to the city centre for the facilities available. We arrived at Ataturk Airport late at night and the taxi to the hotel only cost 10 YTL. The hotel provides a free shuttle to and from Sultanhamet every day and those days we stayed out in town late, we just took the train back - the closest train station is about a 7-8 minutes' pleasant walk. Hotel also provides a free shuttle to and from the airport. Loads of eating places nearby if you don't want to eat in the hotel's 5 restaurants. The nicest surprise of all was a little man-made beach behind the hotel. The hotel health club is really big and nice as well as outdoor pool but the Turkish hamam is really very good and good value compared to the hamams in the city centre, considering it is a five star hotel. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone going to Istanbul, as some days it was actually nice getting away from the crazy hustle and bustle that's Sultanhamet! And the beds are particularly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Novi97
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in Istanbul. Incredible staff and service, close to airport (Ataturk) but VERY quiet, Amazing view of the sea. Superb food in ALL the restaurants. Great beds! I would recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to Istanbul for any purpose. Just cant think of enough great things to say about this property.

Reviews.Title: “stayed before - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: TRAXUK
Reviews.Content: here on business - its a good hotel - near the airport but quiet! Airline crews stay here, so it must be safe/secure and reasonably comfortable. I like it - and as I do all my business at the airport, i dont like to stay downtown where of course there are better hotels. Its not perfect - i could complain about a few things, but the overriding opinion is good enough. anyway - will keep coming back here - dont stay at the SAS Airport, it is not good.

Reviews.Title: “Superior quality Marriott hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmppwwzz
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of nights here on Marriott points at the end of a week in Istanbul after staying at the Empress Zoe in the Sultanahmet. Checked in at around 2pm - friendly staff, no issues. I was surprised at the level of security at the hotel, both the car check and guard at the gate, as well as the metal detector on entry to the hotel lobby. Staying on reward points was no problem on check-in - still the same excellent level of service and friendly attention and was given a concierge level room with views towards the airport. As a plane spotter, that was fine for me, but the better view is out towards the Bosphorous. Istanbul tends to be old fashioned and all the bell hops wore classic pill-box hats so there was a fun old-world feel to the uniforms. The hotel, however looks like it was built in the 1980's, but has been renovated and has a very understated contemporary feel - elegant and warm rather than minimalist - what you would expect. Turks are also very attentive without being over-bearing, and I found the level of service at the hotel to be understated and staff had a pride in their uniforms and jobs that you don't often see in the lower ranks in the United States. This is definitely a business hotel, although there didn't seem to be many businesses close by, so I'm guessing it does a lot of airport and convention trade with the odd wedding thrown in. After staying at the Empress Zoe for the first 5 nights of the week-long vacation, I found the Renaissance to be a pleasant change. The location is not problematic as there's a street close by with shops, cafes and restaurants which gave a more suburban everyday Istanbul expericence. I can't remember what the station is called, but there's also a train station within walking distance of the hotel which takes you to the Sultanahmet - the last station is near the Galata bridge. The train system looks like something out of the Soviet Union, but it's a fascinating way to travel downtown for around US$1 without the hassles of cab drivers/traffic. I headed back to the hotel in the evening to relax in the Concierge lounge. For some reason, it has views towards the airport, rather than the Bosphorous, but there was the usual tasteless h'ors douvers that you would find in any lounge. On the positive side, there was interesting Turkish cheese, beers for free, comfortable lounges and a big TV. Overall, a good experience, no real wow factor, but that's not what was expected.

Reviews.Title: “Polat means "business"”
Reviews.Author: EZE2B
Reviews.Content: The Polat hotel is a new facility looking over the Marmara Sea. At sunrise, tankers can been seen waiting to travel up the Bosphorus River. The hotel has a beautful and enormous pool for laps or wading. There is state of the art work our facilities and equipment, a 4 star spa, a helipad, dock, gift shops, and numerous restuarants on the property. I could be in New York City, LA, or Istanbul- you'd never know the difference. It's in a safe haven. This hotel is for the business traveler only. As long as you (or your company) do not mind paying elevated prices then this is the place for you. This hotel will cater to your every need. There is no Turkish culture at this hotel. The property is also a highly secured with guards and fences. The restuarants are way over priced for the quality and quantity. Take the time and get a tax into town for real Turkish food. There are wonderful places to eat around Taksim Square. It will be cheaper and much more memorable. The Polat is located about 7-8 miles from downtown Istanbul. A tax ride is about $20 USD. There are city buses for about $1.15 #80 or 72T into Eminonu or Taksim. It's easy and convienent to ride the bus. The bus stop is down the street from the hotel. Bottom line, if you want to experience Turkish culture-this is not the place for you. If you are on business or just want to relax and be catered to- you found the right place.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, No Airport Shuttle, Terrible Service, Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: jackieDenver
Reviews.Content: Travelling with the family, I booked two poolside rooms for a night between flights at Ataturk. Website advertised "free airport shuttle," but when I called the hotel upon landing at 11:30am I was advised that the next shuttle wouldn't leave the airport until 2:30pm, so we cabbed the 4 km over to the hotel. Then we learned that the first shuttle in the morning doesn't leave the hotel until 6am (too late for our 5:50am flight, so two more cabs were required, the "free shuttle" wound up costing me 60YTL ($48). Early to bed to make the flight didn't work out so well when an extraordinarily loud poolside wedding party complete with fireworks show kicked off at about 10pm just outside our rooms. I've been in noisy hotels before, but the walls and furniture physically vibrated from this noise. Several phone calls and 45 minutes later the front desk finally found two more rooms on the 16th floor for us and sent two bellmen with the keys. The bellmen stayed behind as we hauled our stuff over to the tower ourselves and up to the 16th, apparently more concerned with inspecting our old rooms to see if we'd stolen some towels or something. The rooms on the 16th didn't actually vibrate, but the wedding band was still uncomfortably audible even up there. However as it was now after 11pm and it had been a long day, we actually fell asleep for a few hours until our early return to the airport. Checkout was one of those protacted affairs where the guy had to wander off to the back office and shuffle through a bunch of papers before he could finally come up with a total and process the payment. The hotel should have never booked the poolside rooms on a night when a big, loud party was planned, and really shouldn't have events that are so loud in any case. This is an overpriced hotel with several ordinary restaurants and poor to non-existent service that seems unaware that people might really want to get to and from the airport and sleep at night at an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: tracyk45
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying at this hotel as a break from some of the small and less well-appointed places we had stayed during our three weeks in Turkey. We stayed here our last night in Turkey, thinking we would have a relaxing night, a great meal. and a sound sleep before we caught our planes early in the AM. Nothing of the sort happened. First of all, three of us piled out of a small taxi loaded down with bags from our travels and no one came to help us with the bags! We then checked in to find that our months' old request to have an extra bed put in the room (we were three women traveling together) had not been noted. The front desk person said he would get a bed up to the room asap. Didn't happen...and when someone finally did come with the bed it became crystal clear he was going to have to dismantle the room to make it fit! We should never have been booked in that size room with the promise that it would fit all of us. We went to the bar for a drink before dinner and saw martinis on the menu...so we ordered two. We were both blown away by the size of the martini, which by the way cost over $20...the thing could not have been more than a quarter of the glass. The server told us, when we complained, that it was because their glasses were so large -- NOT! Our dinner was average but we waited a long time to get our orders taken and between courses. The server was embarrassed enough that he gave us a glass of wine free at the end of the meal. In the Am there were no porters when we struggled down with our bags. The shuttle service to the airport did work as advertised, however. All in all, I would never recommend this hotel (we paid something like $425 for the room) to anyone. Oh, and it is a long ways away from anything in Istanbul. Given the horrible traffic in the city, it took us 55 minutes to get from the Yenikapi ferry boat station to the hotel, a trip that should have taken 12 minutes or so.

Reviews.Title: “great aiport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandalaholland
Reviews.Content: So unusual to sleep next to the aiport and having no trouble with the noise. And a bonos the bed was really comfertable, well you have to lay on the good side, my partner kept rolling to the side, but my ight was lovely. The spa and gym was super, I didn't stay long , because I assumed in turky it would be a men thing, but next time I defently take some proper gym close. The bar in the lobby was nice, again if you are a non smoker you have to be lucky and hope its a evening with not many gueat smoking , otherwise its diffecult to stay smelling fresh. The local wine which they sold, was tasty, but the food was just okay, Its because I am used tofive star food in a five star restaurant, and it wasn't, when we arrived in the afternoon building work was going on , just when I wanted to take a nap, but after I complained they stopped, which I though is good custermer service. And I had a nice few , seeing planes taking of and landing, an dfover the town, whilst the restaurants look out over the oecan

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonyloco
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay.Sure it's a distance from all attractions'but don't worry there is a shuttle that takes you to them.Make sure you make a reservation at the front desk for shuttle.Make sure you ask for a sea view room and the higher the better.Free internet service.Sports Bar on premises with American cousine.Outdoor pool is just fantastic.Store near bye for water and snacks.
